body_html: With the old seq2seq code, I'd say 2 layers of 256 will just not work. 3 layers of 1024 should be fine. But you should really check out the google/seq2seq repo (https://github.com/google/seq2seq). It's a newer and much improved version of TensorFlow seq2seq models. It's may look a bit more complex than the tutorial at first, but if you're after quality and better-tuned models, it'll be worth your while :).

body: With the old seq2seq code, I'd say 2 layers of 256 will just not work. 3 layers of 1024 should be fine. But you should really check out the google/seq2seq repo (https://github.com/google/seq2seq). It's a newer and much improved version of TensorFlow seq2seq models. It's may look a bit more complex than the tutorial at first, but if you're after quality and better-tuned models, it'll be worth your while :).
